learning_outcomes.description: Read and critically analyse current scientific literature pertinent to the area of the occupational hygiene research project.
Formulate research questions and investigate and plan appropriate methods to address these questions, including an appropriate hygiene sampling strategy.
Implement the planned methods, including data collection and analysis, under the guidance of an experienced supervisor.
Record the planning and outcome of data collection accurately and appropriately.
Write a research report in a format appropriate for an occupational hygiene investigation.
Critically discuss the collected data in the context of the literature, draw conclusions from such discussions and suggest further research options.
Appraise their own performance by reflective practice.

assessments.task_description: Using the provided template, submit a 600 to 800 word summary providing an overview of the proposed project, including the overall aim of the project, research questions and brief overview of the methods. Provide details of how the project is relevant to the workplace and discuss the feasibility of its completion within a 240 hour period. The document must be endorsed by the workplace supervisor.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submission via the Turnitin link on the course Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Students are to submit a 3000-4000 word project proposal (including literature review) covering the following elements:
• Title
• General Aim
• Specific objectives/research questions
• Rationale - background and justification of the project
• Literature Review
• Methods
• Resources needed
• References
• Risk Assessment
• Ethical considerations
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submission via Turnitin link on Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Students are to present a research report of 6000 - 8000 words. The report should be prepared in accordance with the AIOH Report Writing Guidelines and also include some additional elements using the following structure: 

·       Title Page

·       Abstract/Executive Summary

·       Table of Contents

·       List of Tables and/or Figures

·       List of Terms and Abbreviations

·       Introduction

·       Relevant Legislation

·       Process Description

·       Literature Review

·       Method (Research design, subjects, data collection tools, procedure)

·       Results

·       Discussion

·       Conclusions and Recommendations

·       Implications for further research

·       References

·       Appendices
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submission via the Turnitin link on the Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: Students will write a 500 - 800 word reflection on the industry research project.

learning_activities.topic:
Orientation

This is an orientation session, which will cover the course requirements and starting your research planning.


Learning outcomes: L01
learning_activities.topic_description: Orientation This is an orientation session, which will cover the course requirements and starting your research planning.

learning_activities.topic:
Research Plan

This session will discuss the research plan, including writing research questions, and thinking about the research methods.
learning_activities.topic_description: Research Plan This session will discuss the research plan, including writing research questions, and thinking about the research methods.

learning_activities.topic:
Research Proposal

This session will discuss the research proposal, including the literature review, methods, timelines and budgets.
learning_activities.topic_description: Research Proposal This session will discuss the research proposal, including the literature review, methods, timelines and budgets.

learning_activities.topic:
Data Collection

This session will discuss the process of data collection.
learning_activities.topic_description: Data Collection This session will discuss the process of data collection.

Research Report
